page.title: 17The school, Hilmarton
page.content: The school was built in 1851 and we still use the original building today. The school consists of three classrooms and there are 69 children, aged between four and eleven, attending at the moment. Many of these children travel to school by coach from the nearby settlements. There is a headmaster, two full-time and one part_time teachers. There is also a secretary, caretaker, welfare assistant and two lunchtime supervisors. The school has a staffroom which is also used as an office for the secretary and headmaster. The school has no hall so therefore we use the church hall for P.E, plays and parties. We have two playgrounds and two playing fields. The school has no kitchen and so school meals are transported from the kitchen at Dunstan School, Calne.
